title: The natural logarithm on complex numbers

blocks.name: clog
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the natural logarithm function on complex numbers.
blocks.origin: const class clog { log }

blocks.name: diff.clog.s
diff.clog.c
diff.clog.w
ccxp
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the complex power function.
blocks.origin: const class ccxp { ^c }

blocks.name: diff.ccxp.s
diff.ccxp.c
diff.ccxp.w
df-log
blocks.content: Define the natural logarithm function on complex numbers. It is defined as the principal value, that is, the inverse of the exponential whose imaginary part lies in the interval (-pi, pi]. See ~ http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natural_logarithm and ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Complex_logarithm . (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Apr-2008.)

blocks.name: df-cxp
blocks.content: Define the power function on complex numbers. Note that the value of this function when ` x = 0 ` and ` ( Re `` y ) <_ 0 , y =/= 0 ` should properly be undefined, but defining it by convention this way simplifies the domain. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Aug-2014.)

blocks.name: logrn
blocks.content: The range of the natural logarithm function, also the principal domain of the exponential function. This allows us to write the longer class expression as simply ` ran log ` . (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Apr-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-May-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm logrn() {
  |- wceq(crn(clog), cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))
} = {
  eqtri(crn(clog), cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)), crn(ccnv(cres(ce, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))))))
  rneqi(clog, ccnv(cres(ce, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))))
  df-log()
  mp2b(wceq(crn(ccnv(cres(ce, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))))), cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))), wf1o(ccnv(cres(ce, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))), cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))), wfo(ccnv(cres(ce, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))), cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))))
  ax-mp(wf1o(ccnv(cres(ce, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))), cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))), wf1o(cres(ce, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))), cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)), cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  eff1o(cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))
  eqid(cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))
  f1ocnv(cres(ce, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))), cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)), cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))
  f1ofo(ccnv(cres(ce, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))), cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))
  forn(ccnv(cres(ce, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))), cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))
}

blocks.name: ellogrn
blocks.content: Write out the property ` A e. ran log ` explicitly. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ellogrn(class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi)))
} = {
  3bitr4i(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi)), wcel(c0, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wa(wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi))))
  bitri(wcel(c0, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wa(wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cfv(cim, c0), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))))
  mp2b(wb(wcel(c0, cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cfv(cim, c0), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))), wf(cim, cc, cr), wfn(cim, cc))
  imf()
  ffn(cim, cc, cr)
  elpreima(cim, cc, c0, co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi))
  pm5.32i(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cfv(cim, c0), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)), wa(wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi)))
  syl6rbbr(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cfv(cim, c0), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)), wa(wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi)), wa(wcel(cfv(cim, c0), cr), wa(wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi))))
  biantrurd(wcel(c0, cc), wa(wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi)), wcel(cfv(cim, c0), cr))
  imcl(c0)
  bitri(wcel(cfv(cim, c0), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)), wa(wcel(cfv(cim, c0), cr), wa(wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi))), w3a(wcel(cfv(cim, c0), cr), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi)))
  mp2an(wb(wcel(cfv(cim, c0), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)), w3a(wcel(cfv(cim, c0), cr), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi))), wcel(cneg(cpi), cxr), wcel(cpi, cr))
  rexri(cneg(cpi))
  renegcli(cpi)
  pire()
  elioc2(cneg(cpi), cpi, cfv(cim, c0))
  3anass(wcel(cfv(cim, c0), cr), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi))
  eleq2i(c0, crn(clog), cima(ccnv(cim), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))
  logrn()
  3anass(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi))
}

blocks.name: dflog2
blocks.content: The natural logarithm function in terms of the exponential function restricted to its principal domain. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Apr-2008.)

blocks.name: relogrn
blocks.content: The range of the natural logarithm function includes the real numbers. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Apr-2008.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 1-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm relogrn(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c0, crn(clog)))
} = {
  syl3anbrc(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi))
  recn(c0)
  syl5breqr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0), nat0, wcel(c0, cr))
  mpbi(wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, nat0), wbr(nat0, clt, cpi))
  ax-mp(wb(wbr(nat0, clt, cpi), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, nat0)), wcel(cpi, cr))
  lt0neg2(cpi)
  syl6eqbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi, nat0, wcel(c0, cr))
  reim0(c0)
  ltleii(nat0, cpi)
  0re()
  pire()
  pipos()
  ellogrn(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm relogrn(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℝ → c0 ∈ ran(log))
} = {
  syl3anbrc(c0 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ran(log), c0 ∈ ℂ, -u(π)[<](Im ` c0), (Im ` c0)[≤]π)
  recn(c0)
  syl5breqr(-u(π), clt, (Im ` c0), nat0, c0 ∈ ℝ)
  mpbi(-u(π)[<]0, 0[<]π)
  ax-mp((0[<]π ↔ -u(π)[<]0), π ∈ ℝ)
  lt0neg2(cpi)
  syl6eqbr((Im ` c0), cle, cpi, nat0, c0 ∈ ℝ)
  reim0(c0)
  ltleii(nat0, cpi)
  0re()
  pire()
  pipos()
  ellogrn(c0)
}

blocks.name: logrncn
blocks.content: The range of the natural logarithm function is a subset of the complex numbers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-May-2014.)

blocks.name: eff1o2
blocks.content: The exponential function restricted to its principal domain maps one-to-one onto the nonzero complex numbers. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Apr-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-May-2014.)

blocks.name: logf1o
blocks.content: The natural logarithm function maps the nonzero complex numbers one-to-one onto its range. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Apr-2008.)

blocks.name: dfrelog
blocks.content: The natural logarithm function on the positive reals in terms of the real exponential function. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Apr-2008.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfrelog() {
  |- wceq(cres(clog, crp), ccnv(cres(ce, cr)))
} = {
  3eqtr4ri(cres(clog, crp), ccnv(cres(ce, cr)), cres(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), cima(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr)), cres(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), crp))
  reseq2i(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), cima(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr), crp)
  3eqtri(cima(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr), crp, crn(cres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr)), crn(cres(ce, cr)))
  df-ima(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr)
  rneqi(cres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr), cres(ce, cr))
  simp3i(wceq(crn(cres(ce, cr)), crp), wfn(cres(ce, cr), cr), wfun(ccnv(cres(ce, cr))))
  mpbi(w3a(wfn(cres(ce, cr), cr), wfun(ccnv(cres(ce, cr))), wceq(crn(cres(ce, cr)), crp)), wf1o(cres(ce, cr), cr, crp))
  reeff1o()
  dff1o2(cres(ce, cr), cr, crp)
  eqtr3i(ccnv(cres(ce, cr)), cres(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), cima(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr)), ccnv(cres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr)))
  cnveqi(cres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr), cres(ce, cr))
  ax-mp(wceq(cres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr), cres(ce, cr)), wss(cr, crn(clog)))
  ssriv(hs0, cr, crn(clog))
  relogrn(cv(hs0))
  resabs1(cr, crn(clog), ce)
  ax-mp(wceq(ccnv(cres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr)), cres(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), cima(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr))), wfun(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog)))))
  mpbi(wfun(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog)))), wfun(clog))
  ax-mp(wfun(clog), wf1o(clog, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), crn(clog)))
  logf1o()
  f1ofun(clog, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), crn(clog))
  funeqi(clog, ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))))
  funcnvres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr)
  reseq1i(clog, crp, ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))))
  dflog2()
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.c(crn(clog))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm dfrelog() {
  ⊢ (log |` ℝ+)= `'(exp |` ℝ)
} = {
  3eqtr4ri((log |` ℝ+), `'(exp |` ℝ), (`'(exp |` ran(log))|`((exp |` ran(log))" ℝ)), (`'(exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ+))
  reseq2i(`'(exp |` ran(log)), ((exp |` ran(log))" ℝ), crp)
  3eqtri(((exp |` ran(log))" ℝ), crp, ran(((exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ)), ran((exp |` ℝ)))
  df-ima((exp |` ran(log)), cr)
  rneqi(((exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ), (exp |` ℝ))
  simp3i(ran((exp |` ℝ))= ℝ+, (exp |` ℝ)[Fn]ℝ, Fun(`'(exp |` ℝ)))
  mpbi(((exp |` ℝ)[Fn]ℝ ∧ Fun(`'(exp |` ℝ))∧ ran((exp |` ℝ))= ℝ+), ((exp |` ℝ): ℝ ↔ ℝ+))
  reeff1o()
  dff1o2((exp |` ℝ), cr, crp)
  eqtr3i(`'(exp |` ℝ), (`'(exp |` ran(log))|`((exp |` ran(log))" ℝ)), `'((exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ))
  cnveqi(((exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ), (exp |` ℝ))
  ax-mp(((exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ)=(exp |` ℝ), ℝ ⊆ ran(log))
  ssriv(hs0, cr, ran(log))
  relogrn(hs0)
  resabs1(cr, ran(log), ce)
  ax-mp(`'((exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ)=(`'(exp |` ran(log))|`((exp |` ran(log))" ℝ)), Fun(`'(exp |` ran(log))))
  mpbi(Fun(`'(exp |` ran(log))), Fun(log))
  ax-mp(Fun(log), (log :(ℂ \ { 0 })↔ ran(log)))
  logf1o()
  f1ofun(clog, (ℂ \ { 0 }), ran(log))
  funeqi(clog, `'(exp |` ran(log)))
  funcnvres((exp |` ran(log)), cr)
  reseq1i(clog, crp, `'(exp |` ran(log)))
  dflog2()
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.c(ran(log))
}

blocks.name: relogf1o
blocks.content: The natural logarithm function maps the positive reals one-to-one onto the real numbers. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Apr-2008.)
blocks.origin:
thm relogf1o() {
  |- wf1o(cres(clog, crp), crp, cr)
} = {
  mpbir(wf1o(cres(clog, crp), crp, cr), wf1o(cres(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), crp), crp, cr))
  mp2an(wf1o(cres(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), crp), crp, cr), wfun(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog)))), wf1o(cres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr), cr, crp))
  ax-mp(wfun(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog)))), wf1o(cres(ce, crn(clog)), crn(clog), cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  eff1o2()
  simprbi(wf1o(cres(ce, crn(clog)), crn(clog), cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wfun(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog)))), wfo(cres(ce, crn(clog)), crn(clog), cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  dff1o3(cres(ce, crn(clog)), crn(clog), cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))
  mpbir(wf1o(cres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr), cr, crp), wf1o(cres(ce, cr), cr, crp))
  reeff1o()
  mp2b(wb(wf1o(cres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr), cr, crp), wf1o(cres(ce, cr), cr, crp)), wss(cr, crn(clog)), wceq(cres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr), cres(ce, cr)))
  ssriv(hs0, cr, crn(clog))
  relogrn(cv(hs0))
  resabs1(cr, crn(clog), ce)
  f1oeq1(cres(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr), cres(ce, cr), cr, crp)
  f1orescnv(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cr, crp)
  mp2b(wb(wf1o(cres(clog, crp), crp, cr), wf1o(cres(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), crp), crp, cr)), wceq(clog, ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog)))), wceq(cres(clog, crp), cres(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), crp)))
  dflog2()
  reseq1(clog, ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), crp)
  f1oeq1(cres(clog, crp), cres(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), crp), crp, cr)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.c(crn(clog))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm relogf1o() {
  ⊢ ((log |` ℝ+): ℝ+ ↔ ℝ)
} = {
  mpbir(((log |` ℝ+): ℝ+ ↔ ℝ), ((`'(exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ+): ℝ+ ↔ ℝ))
  mp2an(((`'(exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ+): ℝ+ ↔ ℝ), Fun(`'(exp |` ran(log))), (((exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ): ℝ ↔ ℝ+))
  ax-mp(Fun(`'(exp |` ran(log))), ((exp |` ran(log)): ran(log)↔(ℂ \ { 0 })))
  eff1o2()
  simprbi(((exp |` ran(log)): ran(log)↔(ℂ \ { 0 })), Fun(`'(exp |` ran(log))), ((exp |` ran(log)): ran(log)↠(ℂ \ { 0 })))
  dff1o3((exp |` ran(log)), ran(log), (ℂ \ { 0 }))
  mpbir((((exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ): ℝ ↔ ℝ+), ((exp |` ℝ): ℝ ↔ ℝ+))
  reeff1o()
  mp2b(((((exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ): ℝ ↔ ℝ+)↔((exp |` ℝ): ℝ ↔ ℝ+)), ℝ ⊆ ran(log), ((exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ)=(exp |` ℝ))
  ssriv(hs0, cr, ran(log))
  relogrn(hs0)
  resabs1(cr, ran(log), ce)
  f1oeq1(((exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ), (exp |` ℝ), cr, crp)
  f1orescnv((exp |` ran(log)), cr, crp)
  mp2b((((log |` ℝ+): ℝ+ ↔ ℝ)↔((`'(exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ+): ℝ+ ↔ ℝ)), log = `'(exp |` ran(log)), (log |` ℝ+)=(`'(exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ+))
  dflog2()
  reseq1(clog, `'(exp |` ran(log)), crp)
  f1oeq1((log |` ℝ+), (`'(exp |` ran(log))|` ℝ+), crp, cr)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.c(ran(log))
}

blocks.name: logrncl
blocks.content: Closure of the natural logarithm function. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Apr-2008.)

blocks.name: logcl
blocks.content: Closure of the natural logarithm function. (Contributed by NM, 21-Apr-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: logimcl
blocks.content: Closure of the imaginary part of the logarithm function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Sep-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 1-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: logcld
blocks.content: The logarithm of a nonzero complex number is a complex number. Deduction form of ~ logcl . (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)

blocks.name: logimcld
blocks.content: The imaginary part of the logarithm is in ` ( -u _pi (,] _pi ) ` . Deduction form of ~ logimcl . Compare ~ logimclad . (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)

blocks.name: logimclad
blocks.content: The imaginary part of the logarithm is in ` ( -u _pi (,] _pi ) ` . Alternate form of ~ logimcld . (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm logimclad(class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c0, nat0))
} = {
  syl3anbrc(w0, wcel(cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)), wcel(cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)), cr), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0))), wbr(cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)), cle, cpi))
  imcld(cfv(clog, c0), w0)
  logcld(c0, w0)
  simpld(w0, wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0))), wbr(cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)), cle, cpi))
  simprd(w0, wbr(cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)), cle, cpi), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0))))
  logimcld(c0, w0)
  mp2an(wb(wcel(cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)), co(cneg(cpi), cioc, cpi)), w3a(wcel(cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)), cr), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0))), wbr(cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)), cle, cpi))), wcel(cneg(cpi), cxr), wcel(cpi, cr))
  rexri(cneg(cpi))
  renegcli(cpi)
  pire()
  elioc2(cneg(cpi), cpi, cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm logimclad(class c0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(Im `(log ` c0))∈(-u(π)[(,]]π))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ ℂ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ≠ 0)
} = {
  syl3anbrc(w0, (Im `(log ` c0))∈(-u(π)[(,]]π), (Im `(log ` c0))∈ ℝ, -u(π)[<](Im `(log ` c0)), (Im `(log ` c0))[≤]π)
  imcld((log ` c0), w0)
  logcld(c0, w0)
  simpld(w0, -u(π)[<](Im `(log ` c0)), (Im `(log ` c0))[≤]π)
  simprd(w0, (Im `(log ` c0))[≤]π, -u(π)[<](Im `(log ` c0)))
  logimcld(c0, w0)
  mp2an(((Im `(log ` c0))∈(-u(π)[(,]]π)↔((Im `(log ` c0))∈ ℝ ∧ -u(π)[<](Im `(log ` c0))∧(Im `(log ` c0))[≤]π)), -u(π)∈ ℝ*, π ∈ ℝ)
  rexri(-u(π))
  renegcli(cpi)
  pire()
  elioc2(-u(π), cpi, (Im `(log ` c0)))
}

blocks.name: abslogimle
blocks.content: The imaginary part of the logarithm function has absolute value less than pi. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jul-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm abslogimle(class c0) {

blocks.name: logrnaddcl
blocks.content: The range of the natural logarithm is closed under addition with reals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Apr-2015.)

thm logrnaddcl(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), crn(clog)))
} = {
  syl3anbrc(wa(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), crn(clog)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cc), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, co(c0, caddc, c1))), wbr(cfv(cim, co(c0, caddc, c1)), cle, cpi))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cc), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  addcl(c0, c1)
  breqtrrd(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, co(c0, caddc, c1)), cfv(cim, c0), wa(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)))
  simp2bi(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)), wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi))
  eqbrtrd(cfv(cim, co(c0, caddc, c1)), cle, cpi, cfv(cim, c0), wa(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr)))
  3eqtrd(cfv(cim, co(c0, caddc, c1)), cfv(cim, c0), co(cfv(cim, c0), caddc, cfv(cim, c1)), co(cfv(cim, c0), caddc, nat0), wa(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr)))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr), wceq(cfv(cim, co(c0, caddc, c1)), co(cfv(cim, c0), caddc, cfv(cim, c1))), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  recn(c1)
  imadd(c0, c1)
  oveq2d(cfv(cim, c0), caddc, cfv(cim, c1), nat0, wa(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr), wceq(cfv(cim, c1), nat0))
  reim0(c1)
  addid1d(cfv(cim, c0), wa(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr)))
  recnd(cfv(cim, c0), wa(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr)))
  imcld(c0, wa(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c0, cc))
  logrncn(c0)
  adantr(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi))
  simp3bi(wcel(c0, crn(clog)), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, cpi), wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cneg(cpi), clt, cfv(cim, c0)))
  ellogrn(c0)
  ellogrn(co(c0, caddc, c1))
}

thm logrnaddcl(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ran(log)∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)→(c0[+]c1)∈ ran(log))
} = {
  syl3anbrc((c0 ∈ ran(log)∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), (c0[+]c1)∈ ran(log), (c0[+]c1)∈ ℂ, -u(π)[<](Im `(c0[+]c1)), (Im `(c0[+]c1))[≤]π)
  syl2an(c0 ∈ ran(log), c1 ∈ ℝ, (c0[+]c1)∈ ℂ, c0 ∈ ℂ, c1 ∈ ℂ)
  addcl(c0, c1)
  breqtrrd(-u(π), clt, (Im `(c0[+]c1)), (Im ` c0), (c0 ∈ ran(log)∧ c1 ∈ ℝ))
  adantr(c0 ∈ ran(log), c1 ∈ ℝ, -u(π)[<](Im ` c0))
  simp2bi(c0 ∈ ran(log), -u(π)[<](Im ` c0), c0 ∈ ℂ, (Im ` c0)[≤]π)
  eqbrtrd((Im `(c0[+]c1)), cle, cpi, (Im ` c0), (c0 ∈ ran(log)∧ c1 ∈ ℝ))
  3eqtrd((Im `(c0[+]c1)), (Im ` c0), ((Im ` c0)[+](Im ` c1)), ((Im ` c0)[+]0), (c0 ∈ ran(log)∧ c1 ∈ ℝ))
  syl2an(c0 ∈ ran(log), c1 ∈ ℝ, (Im `(c0[+]c1))=((Im ` c0)[+](Im ` c1)), c0 ∈ ℂ, c1 ∈ ℂ)
  recn(c1)
  imadd(c0, c1)
  oveq2d((Im ` c0), caddc, (Im ` c1), nat0, (c0 ∈ ran(log)∧ c1 ∈ ℝ))
  adantl(c0 ∈ ran(log), c1 ∈ ℝ, (Im ` c1)= 0)
  reim0(c1)
  addid1d((Im ` c0), (c0 ∈ ran(log)∧ c1 ∈ ℝ))
  recnd((Im ` c0), (c0 ∈ ran(log)∧ c1 ∈ ℝ))
  imcld(c0, (c0 ∈ ran(log)∧ c1 ∈ ℝ))
  adantr(c0 ∈ ran(log), c1 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℂ)
  logrncn(c0)
  adantr(c0 ∈ ran(log), c1 ∈ ℝ, (Im ` c0)[≤]π)
  simp3bi(c0 ∈ ran(log), (Im ` c0)[≤]π, c0 ∈ ℂ, -u(π)[<](Im ` c0))
  ellogrn(c0)
  ellogrn((c0[+]c1))
}

thm eflog(class c0) {

  fveq2i(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cfv(clog, c0), cfv(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), c0))
  fveq1i(clog, c0, ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))))
  dflog2()
  fvresd(ce, crn(clog), cfv(clog, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  logrncl(c0)
  sylbir(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wceq(cfv(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cfv(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), c0)), c0), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  eldifsn(c0, cc, nat0)
  mpan(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wceq(cfv(cres(ce, crn(clog)), cfv(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), c0)), c0), wf1o(cres(ce, crn(clog)), crn(clog), cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  eff1o2()
  f1ocnvfv2(cres(ce, crn(clog)), crn(clog), cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), c0)
}

thm eflog(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0)→(exp `(log ` c0))= c0)
} = {
  3eqtr3a((exp `(log ` c0)), c0, ((exp |` ran(log))`(log ` c0)), ((exp |` ran(log))`(`'(exp |` ran(log))` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  fveq2i((exp |` ran(log)), (log ` c0), (`'(exp |` ran(log))` c0))

  eldifsn(c0, cc, nat0)

  eff1o2()
  f1ocnvfv2((exp |` ran(log)), ran(log), (ℂ \ { 0 }), c0)
}

blocks.name: logeq0im1

blocks.name: logccne0

blocks.name: logne0

  bitr3d(wa(wcel(c1, crn(clog)), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))), wceq(cfv(ce, c1), c0), wceq(cfv(ccnv(cres(ce, crn(clog))), c0), c1), wceq(cfv(cres(ce, crn(clog)), c1), c0))

  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℝ+ →(log ` -u(c0))=((log ` c0)[+](i[×]π)))

thm relogoprlem(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crp), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(cfv(clog, co(c0, c2, c1)), co(cfv(clog, c0), c3, cfv(clog, c1))))

  -| wi(wa(wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cr), wcel(cfv(clog, c1), cr)), wcel(co(cfv(clog, c0), c3, cfv(clog, c1)), cr))
} = {
  eqtr3d(cfv(clog, co(c0, c2, c1)), co(cfv(clog, c0), c3, cfv(clog, c1)), cfv(clog, co(cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c0)), c2, cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, crp), wcel(c1, crp)))
  fveq2d(clog, co(cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c0)), c2, cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c1))), co(c0, c2, c1), wa(wcel(c0, crp), wcel(c1, crp)))
  oveqan12d(cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c0)), c2, cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c1)), c0, c1, wcel(c0, crp), wcel(c1, crp))
  reeflog(c0)
  reeflog(c1)
  syl2an(wcel(c0, crp), wcel(c1, crp), wceq(cfv(clog, co(cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c0)), c2, cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c1)))), co(cfv(clog, c0), c3, cfv(clog, c1))), wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cr), wcel(cfv(clog, c1), cr))
  relogcl(c0)
  relogcl(c1)
  eqtr3d(cfv(clog, co(cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c0)), c2, cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c1)))), co(cfv(clog, c0), c3, cfv(clog, c1)), cfv(clog, cfv(ce, co(cfv(clog, c0), c3, cfv(clog, c1)))), wa(wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cr), wcel(cfv(clog, c1), cr)))
  syl2an(wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cr), wcel(cfv(clog, c1), cr), wceq(cfv(clog, cfv(ce, co(cfv(clog, c0), c3, cfv(clog, c1)))), cfv(clog, co(cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c0)), c2, cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c1))))), wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cc), wcel(cfv(clog, c1), cc))
  recn(cfv(clog, c0))

blocks.name: relogmul
blocks.content: The natural logarithm of the product of two positive real numbers is the sum of natural logarithms. Property 2 of [Cohen] p. 301, restricted to natural logarithms. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 25-Nov-2007.)

blocks.name: relogdiv
blocks.content: The natural logarithm of the quotient of two positive real numbers is the difference of natural logarithms. Exercise 72(a) and Property 3 of [Cohen] p. 301, restricted to natural logarithms. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 25-Nov-2007.)

blocks.name: explog
blocks.content: Exponentiation of a nonzero complex number to an integer power. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Apr-2008.)

blocks.name: reexplog
blocks.content: Exponentiation of a positive real number to an integer power. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 25-Nov-2007.)

blocks.name: relogexp
blocks.content: The natural logarithm of positive ` A ` raised to an integer power. Property 4 of [Cohen] p. 301-302, restricted to natural logarithms and integer powers ` N ` . (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 25-Nov-2007.)

blocks.name: relogiso
blocks.content: The natural logarithm function on positive reals determines an isomorphism from the positive reals onto the reals. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 25-Nov-2007.)

blocks.name: reloggim
blocks.content: The natural logarithm is a group isomorphism from the group of positive reals under multiplication to the group of reals under addition. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Jun-2015.) (Revised by Thierry Arnoux, 30-Jun-2019.)

  ancoms(wcel(c0, crp), wcel(c1, crp), wb(wbr(c1, clt, c0), wbr(cfv(clog, c1), clt, cfv(clog, c0))))

  3adant3(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cc))
  logcl(c0)
  recnd(cfv(clog, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wcel(c1, crp)))

thm logmul2(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+)→(log `(c0[×]c1))=((log ` c0)[+](log ` c1)))
} = {
  eqtr3d((log `(c0[×]c1)), ((log ` c0)[+](log ` c1)), (log `(exp `((log ` c0)[+](log ` c1)))), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+))
  fveq2d(clog, (exp `((log ` c0)[+](log ` c1))), (c0[×]c1), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+))
  eqtrd((exp `((log ` c0)[+](log ` c1))), (c0[×]c1), ((exp `(log ` c0))[×](exp `(log ` c1))), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+))
  syl2anc((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+), (exp `((log ` c0)[+](log ` c1)))=((exp `(log ` c0))[×](exp `(log ` c1))), (log ` c0)∈ ℂ, (log ` c1)∈ ℂ)
  3adant3(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0, c1 ∈ ℝ+, (log ` c0)∈ ℂ)
  logcl(c0)
  recnd((log ` c1), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+))
  efadd((log ` c0), (log ` c1))
  oveq12d((exp `(log ` c0)), cmul, (exp `(log ` c1)), c0, c1, (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+))
  3adant3(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0, c1 ∈ ℝ+, (exp `(log ` c0))= c0)
  eflog(c0)
  3ad2ant3(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0, c1 ∈ ℝ+, (exp `(log ` c1))= c1)
  reeflog(c1)
  syl((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+), (log `(exp `((log ` c0)[+](log ` c1))))=((log ` c0)[+](log ` c1)), ((log ` c0)[+](log ` c1))∈ ran(log))
  syl2anc((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+), ((log ` c0)[+](log ` c1))∈ ran(log), (log ` c0)∈ ran(log), (log ` c1)∈ ℝ)
  3adant3(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0, c1 ∈ ℝ+, (log ` c0)∈ ran(log))
  logrncl(c0)
  3ad2ant3(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0, c1 ∈ ℝ+, (log ` c1)∈ ℝ)
  relogcl(c1)
  logrnaddcl((log ` c0), (log ` c1))

blocks.name: logdivlti
blocks.content: The ` log x / x ` function is strictly decreasing on the reals greater than ` _e ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: logdivlt
blocks.content: The ` log x / x ` function is strictly decreasing on the reals greater than ` _e ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: logdivle
blocks.content: The ` log x / x ` function is strictly decreasing on the reals greater than ` _e ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-May-2016.)

thm logdivle(class c0, class c1) {

blocks.name: relogcld
blocks.content: Closure of the natural logarithm function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: reeflogd
blocks.content: Relationship between the natural logarithm function and the exponential function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: relogmuld
blocks.content: The natural logarithm of the product of two positive real numbers is the sum of natural logarithms. Property 2 of [Cohen] p. 301, restricted to natural logarithms. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: relogdivd
blocks.content: The natural logarithm of the quotient of two positive real numbers is the difference of natural logarithms. Exercise 72(a) and Property 3 of [Cohen] p. 301, restricted to natural logarithms. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: logled
blocks.content: Natural logarithm preserves ` <_ ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: relogefd
blocks.content: Relationship between the natural logarithm function and the exponential function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: rplogcld
blocks.content: Closure of the logarithm function in the positive reals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: logge0d
blocks.content: The logarithm of a number greater than 1 is nonnegative. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: logge0b
blocks.content: The logarithm of a number is nonnegative iff the number is greater than or equal to 1. (Contributed by AV, 30-May-2020.)

blocks.name: loggt0b
blocks.content: The logarithm of a number is positive iff the number is greater than 1. (Contributed by AV, 30-May-2020.)

blocks.name: logle1b
blocks.content: The logarithm of a number is less than or equal to 1 iff the number is less than or equal to Euler's constant. (Contributed by AV, 30-May-2020.)

blocks.name: loglt1b
blocks.content: The logarithm of a number is less than 1 iff the number is less than Euler's constant. (Contributed by AV, 30-May-2020.)

blocks.name: divlogrlim

thm relogcn() {
  |- wcel(cres(clog, crp), co(crp, ccncf, cr))
} = {
  mpbir(wcel(cres(clog, crp), co(crp, ccncf, cr)), wf(cres(clog, crp), crp, cr))
  mp2an(wb(wcel(cres(clog, crp), co(crp, ccncf, cr)), wf(cres(clog, crp), crp, cr)), wss(cr, cc), wcel(cres(clog, crp), co(crp, ccncf, cc)))
  mp3an(wcel(cres(clog, crp), co(crp, ccncf, cc)), wss(cr, cc), wf(cres(clog, crp), crp, cc), wss(crp, cr))
  mp2an(wf(cres(clog, crp), crp, cc), wf(cres(clog, crp), crp, cr), wss(cr, cc))
  ax-mp(wf(cres(clog, crp), crp, cr), wf1o(cres(clog, crp), crp, cr))
  relogf1o()
  f1of(cres(clog, crp), crp, cr)
  ax-resscn()
  fss(cres(clog, crp), crp, cr, cc)
  rpssre()
  mpan2(w3a(wss(cr, cc), wf(cres(clog, crp), crp, cc), wss(crp, cr)), wcel(cres(clog, crp), co(crp, ccncf, cc)), wceq(cdm(co(cr, cdv, cres(clog, crp))), crp))
  dmmpti(hs0, co(cr, cdv, cres(clog, crp)), crp, co(nat1, cdiv, cv(hs0)))
  ovex(nat1, cdiv, cv(hs0))
  dvrelog(hs0)
  dvcn(cr, cres(clog, crp), crp)
  cncffvrn(cr, cres(clog, crp), crp, cc)
  diff.hs0.c(crp)
}

thm ellogdm(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wi(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c0, crp))))
  -| wceq(c1, cdif(cc, co(cmnf, cioc, nat0)))
} = {

blocks.name: logdmn0
blocks.content: A number in the continuous domain of ` log ` is nonzero. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm logdmn0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, nat0))
  -| wceq(c1, cdif(cc, co(cmnf, cioc, nat0)))
} = {
  necon2ai(c0, nat0, wcel(c0, c1))
  mtbiri(wceq(c0, nat0), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(nat0, c1))
  mto(wcel(nat0, c1), wcel(nat0, crp))
  0nrp()
  mpi(wcel(nat0, c1), wcel(nat0, crp), wcel(nat0, cr))
  0re()
  simprbi(wcel(nat0, c1), wi(wcel(nat0, cr), wcel(nat0, crp)), wcel(nat0, cc))
  ellogdm(nat0, c1)
  eleq1(c0, nat0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm logdmn0(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ≠ 0)
  ⊣ c1 =(ℂ \(-∞[(,]]0))
} = {
  necon2ai(c0, nat0, c0 ∈ c1)
  mtbiri(c0 = 0, c0 ∈ c1, 0 ∈ c1)
  mto(0 ∈ c1, 0 ∈ ℝ+)
  0nrp()
  mpi(0 ∈ c1, 0 ∈ ℝ+, 0 ∈ ℝ)
  0re()
  simprbi(0 ∈ c1, (0 ∈ ℝ → 0 ∈ ℝ+), 0 ∈ ℂ)
  ellogdm(nat0, c1)
  eleq1(c0, nat0, c1)
}

blocks.name: logdmnrp

  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cneg(c0), crp), wbr(nat0, clt, cneg(c0)))

  imp(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cneg(c0), crp), wcel(c0, cr))
  syl5ib(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cneg(c0), crp), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cneg(c0), cr))
  rpre(cneg(c0))

blocks.name: logdmss

blocks.name: logcnlem2
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ logcn . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm logcnlem2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cif(c0, c1, wbr(c0, cle, c1)), crp))
  -| wceq(c2, cdif(cc, co(cmnf, cioc, nat0)))
  -| wceq(c0, cif(c3, cfv(cabs, cfv(cim, c3)), wcel(c3, crp)))
  -| wceq(c1, co(cfv(cabs, c3), cmul, co(c4, cdiv, co(nat1, caddc, c4))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, crp))
} = {
  ifcld(c0, c1, crp, w0, wbr(c0, cle, c1))
  syl5eqel(c0, crp, cif(c3, cfv(cabs, cfv(cim, c3)), wcel(c3, crp)), w0)
  ifclda(c3, cfv(cabs, cfv(cim, c3)), crp, w0, wcel(c3, crp))
  simpr(w0, wcel(c3, crp))
  absrpcld(cfv(cim, c3), wa(w0, wn(wcel(c3, crp))))
  recnd(cfv(cim, c3), wa(w0, wn(wcel(c3, crp))))
  adantr(w0, wn(wcel(c3, crp)), wcel(cfv(cim, c3), cr))
  imcld(c3, w0)
  imp(w0, wn(wcel(c3, crp)), wne(cfv(cim, c3), nat0))
  necon3bd(cfv(cim, c3), nat0, w0, wcel(c3, crp))
  sylbird(w0, wceq(cfv(cim, c3), nat0), wcel(c3, crp), wcel(c3, cr))
  syl(w0, wb(wcel(c3, cr), wceq(cfv(cim, c3), nat0)), wcel(c3, cc))
  reim0b(c3)
  syl(w0, wi(wcel(c3, cr), wcel(c3, crp)), wcel(c3, c2))
  simprbi(wcel(c3, c2), wi(wcel(c3, cr), wcel(c3, crp)), wcel(c3, cc))
  syl5eqel(c1, crp, co(cfv(cabs, c3), cmul, co(c4, cdiv, co(nat1, caddc, c4))), w0)
  rpmulcld(cfv(cabs, c3), co(c4, cdiv, co(nat1, caddc, c4)), w0)
  absrpcld(c3, w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(c3, cc), wcel(c3, c2))
  simplbi(wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c3, cc), wi(wcel(c3, cr), wcel(c3, crp)))
  ellogdm(c3, c2)
  syl(w0, wne(c3, nat0), wcel(c3, c2))
  logdmn0(c3, c2)
  rpdivcld(c4, co(nat1, caddc, c4), w0)
  sylancr(w0, wcel(co(nat1, caddc, c4), crp), wcel(nat1, crp), wcel(c4, crp))
  1rp()
  rpaddcl(nat1, c4)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm logcnlem2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → if(c0[≤]c1, c0, c1)∈ ℝ+)
  ⊣ c2 =(ℂ \(-∞[(,]]0))
  ⊣ c0 = if(c3 ∈ ℝ+, c3,(abs `(Im ` c3)))
  ⊣ c1 =((abs ` c3)[×](c4[÷](1[+]c4)))
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ ℝ+)
} = {
  ifcld(c0, c1, crp, w0, c0[≤]c1)
  syl5eqel(c0, crp, if(c3 ∈ ℝ+, c3,(abs `(Im ` c3))), w0)
  ifclda(c3, (abs `(Im ` c3)), crp, w0, c3 ∈ ℝ+)
  simpr(w0, c3 ∈ ℝ+)
  absrpcld((Im ` c3), (w0 ∧ ¬ c3 ∈ ℝ+))
  recnd((Im ` c3), (w0 ∧ ¬ c3 ∈ ℝ+))
  adantr(w0, ¬ c3 ∈ ℝ+, (Im ` c3)∈ ℝ)
  imcld(c3, w0)
  imp(w0, ¬ c3 ∈ ℝ+, (Im ` c3)≠ 0)
  necon3bd((Im ` c3), nat0, w0, c3 ∈ ℝ+)
  sylbird(w0, (Im ` c3)= 0, c3 ∈ ℝ+, c3 ∈ ℝ)
  syl(w0, (c3 ∈ ℝ ↔(Im ` c3)= 0), c3 ∈ ℂ)
  reim0b(c3)
  syl(w0, (c3 ∈ ℝ → c3 ∈ ℝ+), c3 ∈ c2)
  simprbi(c3 ∈ c2, (c3 ∈ ℝ → c3 ∈ ℝ+), c3 ∈ ℂ)
  syl5eqel(c1, crp, ((abs ` c3)[×](c4[÷](1[+]c4))), w0)
  rpmulcld((abs ` c3), (c4[÷](1[+]c4)), w0)
  absrpcld(c3, w0)
  syl(w0, c3 ∈ ℂ, c3 ∈ c2)
  simplbi(c3 ∈ c2, c3 ∈ ℂ, (c3 ∈ ℝ → c3 ∈ ℝ+))
  ellogdm(c3, c2)
  syl(w0, c3 ≠ 0, c3 ∈ c2)
  logdmn0(c3, c2)
  rpdivcld(c4, (1[+]c4), w0)
  sylancr(w0, (1[+]c4)∈ ℝ+, 1 ∈ ℝ+, c4 ∈ ℝ+)
  1rp()
  rpaddcl(nat1, c4)
}

blocks.content: The logarithm function is continuous away from the branch cut at negative reals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: logdmopn
blocks.content: The "continuous domain" of ` log ` is an open set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: logf1o2
blocks.content: The logarithm maps its continuous domain bijectively onto the set of numbers with imaginary part ` -u _pi < Im ( z ) < _pi ` . The negative reals are mapped to the numbers with imaginary part equal to ` _pi ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-May-2015.)

blocks.name: dvlog
blocks.content: The derivative of the complex logarithm function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: advlogexp
blocks.content: The antiderivative of a power of the logarithm. (Set ` A = 1 ` and multiply by ` ( -u 1 ) ^ N x. N ! ` to get the antiderivative of ` log ( x ) ^ N ` itself.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-May-2016.)

blocks.name: logtaylsum
blocks.content: The Taylor series for ` -u log ( 1 - A ) ` , as an infinite sum. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm logtaylsum(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, nat1)), wceq(csu(s0, cn, co(co(c0, cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, cv(s0))), cneg(cfv(clog, co(nat1, cmin, c0)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  isumclim(s0, cn, co(co(c0, cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, cv(s0)), cneg(cfv(clog, co(nat1, cmin, c0))), nat1, cmpt(hs0, cn, co(co(c0, cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, cv(hs0))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, nat1)))
  nnuz()
  1zzd(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, nat1)))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, nat1)), wcel(cv(s0), cn), wceq(cfv(cmpt(hs0, cn, co(co(c0, cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, cv(hs0))), cv(s0)), co(co(c0, cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, cv(s0))))
  fvmpt(hs0, cv(s0), cn, cmpt(hs0, cn, co(co(c0, cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, cv(hs0))), co(co(c0, cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, cv(s0)), co(co(c0, cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, cv(hs0)))
  oveq12d(co(c0, cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, cv(hs0), co(c0, cexp, cv(s0)), cv(s0), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), cv(s0), c0, cexp)
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, cn, co(co(c0, cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, cv(hs0))))
  ovex(co(c0, cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, cv(s0))
  divcld(co(c0, cexp, cv(s0)), cv(s0), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, nat1)), wcel(cv(s0), cn)))
  syl2an(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, nat1)), wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(co(c0, cexp, cv(s0)), cc), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cv(s0), cn0))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, nat1))
  nnnn0(cv(s0))
  expcl(c0, cv(s0))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, nat1)), wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(s0), cc))
  nncn(cv(s0))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, nat1)), wcel(cv(s0), cn), wne(cv(s0), nat0))
  nnne0(cv(s0))
  logtayl(hs0, c0)
  diff.cmpt.s(s0, hs0, cn, co(co(c0, cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, cv(hs0)))
  diff.cn.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, co(c0, cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, cv(hs0))
  diff.co.s(s0, c0, cexp, cv(hs0))
  diff.cexp.s(s0)
  diff.cdiv.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, nat1))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cc)
  diff.cc.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, cfv(cabs, c0), clt, nat1)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cabs, c0)
  diff.cabs.s(s0)
  diff.clt.s(s0)
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s0))
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.hs0.c(co(co(c0, cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, cv(s0)))

}

  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(abs ` c0)[<]1)→ sum(s0 ∈ ℕ,((c0[^]s0)[÷]s0))= -u((log `(1[-]c0))))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)

  nnuz()
  1zzd((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(abs ` c0)[<]1))
  adantl((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(abs ` c0)[<]1), s0 ∈ ℕ, ((hs0 ∈ ℕ ↦((c0[^]hs0)[÷]hs0))` s0)=((c0[^]s0)[÷]s0))
  fvmpt(hs0, s0, cn, (hs0 ∈ ℕ ↦((c0[^]hs0)[÷]hs0)), ((c0[^]s0)[÷]s0), ((c0[^]hs0)[÷]hs0))
  oveq12d((c0[^]hs0), cdiv, hs0, (c0[^]s0), s0, hs0 = s0)

  id(hs0 = s0)

  divcld((c0[^]s0), s0, ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(abs ` c0)[<]1)∧ s0 ∈ ℕ))
  syl2an((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(abs ` c0)[<]1), s0 ∈ ℕ, (c0[^]s0)∈ ℂ, c0 ∈ ℂ, s0 ∈ ℕ0)
  simpl(c0 ∈ ℂ, (abs ` c0)[<]1)
  nnnn0(s0)
  expcl(c0, s0)
  adantl((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(abs ` c0)[<]1), s0 ∈ ℕ, s0 ∈ ℂ)

thm logtayl2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {

  -| wceq(c1, co(nat1, cfv(cbl, ccom(cabs, cmin)), nat1))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  breqtrd(cseq(nat1, caddc, cmpt(s0, cn, co(co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cdiv, cv(s0)), cmul, co(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cexp, cv(s0))))), cli, cfv(clog, c0), co(cneg(nat1), cmul, cneg(cfv(clog, c0))), wcel(c0, c1))
  isermulc2(hs0, nat1, cmpt(s0, cn, co(co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cdiv, cv(s0)), cmul, co(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cexp, cv(s0)))), cneg(nat1), cneg(cfv(clog, c0)), cn, cmpt(s0, cn, co(co(co(nat1, cmin, c0), cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, cv(s0))), wcel(c0, c1))
  nnuz()
  1zzd(wcel(c0, c1))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cneg(nat1), cc))
  breqtrd(cseq(nat1, caddc, cmpt(s0, cn, co(co(co(nat1, cmin, c0), cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, cv(s0)))), cli, cneg(cfv(clog, c0)), cneg(cfv(clog, co(nat1, cmin, co(nat1, cmin, c0)))), wcel(c0, c1))
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(cseq(nat1, caddc, cmpt(s0, cn, co(co(co(nat1, cmin, c0), cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, cv(s0)))), cli, cneg(cfv(clog, co(nat1, cmin, co(nat1, cmin, c0))))), wcel(co(nat1, cmin, c0), cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(nat1, cmin, c0)), clt, nat1))

  sylancr(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(co(nat1, ccom(cabs, cmin), c0), cfv(cabs, co(nat1, cmin, c0))), wcel(nat1, cc), wcel(c0, cc))
  cnmetdval(nat1, c0, ccom(cabs, cmin))

  negeqd(cfv(clog, co(nat1, cmin, co(nat1, cmin, c0))), cfv(clog, c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  fveq2d(clog, co(nat1, cmin, co(nat1, cmin, c0)), c0, wcel(c0, c1))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(co(nat1, cmin, co(nat1, cmin, c0)), c0), wcel(nat1, cc), wcel(c0, cc))
  nncan(nat1, c0)

blocks.name: logccv
blocks.content: The natural logarithm function on the reals is a strictly concave function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)

  syl2an(wcel(c0, crp), wcel(c1, cr), wceq(co(c0, ccxp, c1), cfv(ce, co(c1, cmul, cfv(clog, c0)))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cc))
  rpcnne0(c0)

}

thm rpcxpcl(class c0, class c1) {

} = {

  recxpcl(c0, c1)

  syl((c0 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), 0[<](exp `(c1[×](log ` c0))), (c1[×](log ` c0))∈ ℝ)
  syl2anr(c0 ∈ ℝ+, c1 ∈ ℝ, (c1[×](log ` c0))∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, (log ` c0)∈ ℝ)
  id(c1 ∈ ℝ)
  relogcl(c0)
  remulcl(c1, (log ` c0))
  efgt0((c1[×](log ` c0)))
  syl2an(c0 ∈ ℝ+, c1 ∈ ℝ, (c0[^c]c1)=(exp `(c1[×](log ` c0))), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0), c1 ∈ ℂ)

blocks.name: cxpne0

  cxpef(c0, c1)

blocks.name: cxproot
blocks.content: The complex power function allows us to write n-th roots via the idiom ` A ^c ( 1 / N ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm cxproot(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn)), wceq(co(co(c0, ccxp, co(nat1, cdiv, c1)), cexp, c1), c0))
} = {
  3eqtr3d(co(co(c0, ccxp, co(nat1, cdiv, c1)), cexp, c1), c0, co(c0, ccxp, co(co(nat1, cdiv, c1), cmul, c1)), co(c0, ccxp, nat1), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn)))
  oveq2d(c0, ccxp, co(co(nat1, cdiv, c1), cmul, c1), nat1, wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn)))
  recid2d(c1, wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c1, cc))
  nncn(c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn), wne(c1, nat0))
  nnne0(c1)
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn)), wceq(co(c0, ccxp, co(co(nat1, cdiv, c1), cmul, c1)), co(co(c0, ccxp, co(nat1, cdiv, c1)), cexp, c1)), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(co(nat1, cdiv, c1), cc), wcel(c1, cn0))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn))
  recnd(co(nat1, cdiv, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(co(nat1, cdiv, c1), cr))
  nnrecre(c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c1, cn0))
  nnnn0(c1)
  cxpmul2(c0, co(nat1, cdiv, c1), c1)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, ccxp, nat1), c0))
  cxp1(c0)
}

thm cxplt(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  3bitr4d(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr))), wbr(c1, clt, c2), wbr(co(c0, ccxp, c1), clt, co(c0, ccxp, c2)), wbr(co(c1, cmul, cfv(clog, c0)), clt, co(c2, cmul, cfv(clog, c0))), wbr(cfv(ce, co(c1, cmul, cfv(clog, c0))), clt, cfv(ce, co(c2, cmul, cfv(clog, c0)))))

  remulcld(c1, cfv(clog, c0), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr))))

blocks.name: cxpsqrt
blocks.content: The complex exponential function with exponent ` 1 / 2 ` exactly matches the complex square root function (the branch cut is in the same place for both functions), and thus serves as a suitable generalization to other ` n ` -th roots and irrational roots. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Aug-2014.)

blocks.name: 2irrexpq
blocks.content: There exist irrational numbers ` a ` and ` b ` such that ` ( a ^c b ) ` is rational. Statement in the Metamath book, section 1.1.5, footnote 27 on page 17, and the "classical proof" for theorem 1.2 of [Bauer], p. 483. This proof is not acceptable in intuitionistic logic, since it is based on the law of excluded middle: Either ` ( ( sqrt `` 2 ) ^c ( sqrt `` 2 ) ) ` is rational, in which case ` ( sqrt `` 2 ) ` , being irrational (see ~ sqrt2irr ), can be chosen for both ` a ` and ` b ` , or ` ( ( sqrt `` 2 ) ^c ( sqrt `` 2 ) ) ` is irrational, in which case ` ( ( sqrt `` 2 ) ^c ( sqrt `` 2 ) ) ` can be chosen for ` a ` and ` ( sqrt `` 2 ) ` for ` b ` , since ` ( ( ( sqrt `` 2 ) ^c ( sqrt `` 2 ) ) ^c ( sqrt `` 2 ) ) = 2 ` is rational. For an alternate proof, which can be used in intuitionistic logic, see ~ 2irrexpqALT . (Contributed by AV, 23-Dec-2022.)

blocks.name: cxpcn3
blocks.content: Extend continuity of the complex power function to a base of zero, as long as the exponent has strictly positive real part. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: resqrtcn
blocks.content: Continuity of the real square root function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-May-2016.)

thm root1id(class c0) {

blocks.name: root1eq1
blocks.content: The only powers of an ` N ` -th root of unity that equal ` 1 ` are the multiples of ` N ` . In other words, ` -u 1 ^c ( 2 / N ) ` has order ` N ` in the multiplicative group of nonzero complex numbers. (In fact, these and their powers are the only elements of finite order in the complex numbers.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2016.)

blocks.name: cxpeq
blocks.content: Solve an equation involving an ` N ` -th power. The expression ` -u 1 ^c ( 2 / N ) = exp ( 2 _pi _i / N ) ` is a way to write the primitive ` N ` -th root of unity with the smallest positive argument. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: loglesqrt
blocks.content: An upper bound on the logarithm. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-May-2016.) (Proof shortened by AV, 2-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: logrec
blocks.content: Logarithm of a reciprocal changes sign. (Contributed by Saveliy Skresanov, 28-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm logrec(class c0) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)), cpi)), wceq(cfv(clog, c0), cneg(cfv(clog, co(nat1, cdiv, c0)))))
} = {
  3eqtr3d(cfv(clog, c0), cneg(cfv(clog, co(nat1, cdiv, c0))), cfv(clog, cfv(ce, cfv(clog, c0))), cfv(clog, cfv(ce, cneg(cfv(clog, co(nat1, cdiv, c0))))), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(cfv(cim, cfv(clog, c0)), cpi)))
